intro: Willemetia eriophora, commonly known as the sandverbena, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a small, herbaceous annual that typically grows in sandy or gravelly soils. The plant features simple, opposite leaves and produces small, clustered flowers in shades of white or pale blue. It is often found in coastal or inland areas with well-drained soils. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
